With a team that diverse, we are setting new standards of performance and raising the bar in excellent service delivery.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Videographer

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos&nbsp;
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	We are seeking a creative and highly skilled Videographer to join our marketing team.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for conceptualizing, shooting, and editing compelling video content that supports QMB&#39;s multi-business ecosystem, including the hypermart, restaurants, club, spa, salon, laundromat, apartments, and events.
	This role works closely with the social media team and brand leads to ensure consistent storytelling, promotional content, and brand-aligned visuals.


Responsibilities


	Film and edit high-quality video content for all QMB businesses (e.g., product features, events, walkthroughs, behind-the-scenes).
	Collaborate with social media and marketing teams to plan content calendars and campaign visuals.
	Capture live events (e.g., Friday club nights, events, apartment tours, chef features, product promos).
	Maintain an organized video archive and ensure proper labeling and versioning.
	Suggest innovative formats (e.g., reels, IG/YouTube shorts, documentaries).
	Manage lighting, sound, and basic production setups.
	Optimize videos for different platforms (Instagram, TikTok, YouTube, website).


Requirements


	2+ years of videography and editing experience (lifestyle/retail/hospitality&nbsp;preferred)
	Proficiency in Adobe Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro, or DaVinci Resolve
	Working knowledge of motion graphics (After Effects is a plus)
	Portfolio showcasing storytelling, editing, and brand-focused videos
	Ability to work independently and under tight deadlines
	Familiarity with Instagram, TikTok, and YouTube content trends
	A team-first attitude with strong communication skills.

Videographer Job at Tribest Corporate Support Limited




        
    

        
        Tribest is a corporate support solutions provider with a comprehensive range of people outsourcing services. We have a diversified team of management, strategy, banking and capacity development experts working together to provide organizations with the best human resource management solutions. With a team that diverse, we are setting new standards of performance and raising the bar in excellent service delivery.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Videographer

Job Location: Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

            
    




	We are seeking a creative and highly skilled Videographer to join our marketing team.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for conceptualizing, shooting, and editing compelling video content that supports QMB's multi-business ecosystem, including the hypermart, restaurants, club, spa, salon, laundromat, apartments, and events.
	This role works closely with the social media team and brand leads to ensure consistent storytelling, promotional content, and brand-aligned visuals.


Responsibilities


	Film and edit high-quality video content for all QMB businesses (e.g., product features, events, walkthroughs, behind-the-scenes).
	Collaborate with social media and marketing teams to plan content calendars and campaign visuals.
	Capture live events (e.g., Friday club nights, events, apartment tours, chef features, product promos).
	Maintain an organized video archive and ensure proper labeling and versioning.
	Suggest innovative formats (e.g., reels, IG/YouTube shorts, documentaries).
	Manage lighting, sound, and basic production setups.
	Optimize videos for different platforms (Instagram, TikTok, YouTube, website).


Requirements


	2+ years of videography and editing experience (lifestyle/retail/hospitality preferred)
	Proficiency in Adobe Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro, or DaVinci Resolve
	Working knowledge of motion graphics (After Effects is a plus)
	Portfolio showcasing storytelling, editing, and brand-focused videos
	Ability to work independently and under tight deadlines
	Familiarity with Instagram, TikTok, and YouTube content trends
	A team-first attitude with strong communication skills.

Administrative Associate Job at Nomba




        
    

        
        Nomba, launched in 2017 as "Kudi.ai", is a chatbot that responds to financial requests on social apps. Nomba has since evolved to empower independent businesses to act as neighborhood banks offering basic financial services such as cash withdrawal, transfer and bill payments to all Nigerians, especially those in underserved communities. Today we process more than $500m in payments monthly.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Administrative Associate

Job Location: Lagos

About the Role
     

            
    




	We are looking for an Administrative Associate to join our team and support our daily office procedures.
	In this role, you will handle all administrative and logistics functions and ensure that all requests are attended to on time.
	As our Administrative Associate, you will act as the point of contact for all employees, providing administrative support and managing their queries.
	You must also be competent in prioritising, working with little supervision, self-motivated and trustworthy.


Responsibilities


	Responsible for the smooth day-to-day running of the office, overseeing administrative and operational matters, and ensuring a well-presented, orderly, and aesthetically appealing work environment.
	Handling all company logistics requests, especially the shipment and tracking of tools and equipment in line with the company’s processes.
	Providing excellent customer service at the reception and administrative support to departments, as required and requested.
	Managing office inventory and working with vendors to ensure the regular supply of office materials.
	Maintaining proper and accurate records/inventory of office supplies, distribution and usage.
	Resolving maintenance issues for the facility and adhering to general servicing schedules.


Requirements


	A Bachelor's Degree from an accredited university.
	At least 2+ years of hands-on experience in office administration.
	Excellent record-keeping and documentation skills including proficiency in Microsoft Suite.
	Ability to manage multiple priorities.
	Strong aesthetic sense with attention to design, orderliness, and office appearance.
	Excellent stakeholder management skills.
	Great people skills and ability to communicate (negative & positive) feedback.
	Good organizational skills.
	Be able to adapt within a fast-paced environment, dealing with ambiguity and prioritising deliverables according to the business needs.
	An assertive individual with the ability to work under minimal supervision.
	Experience handling logistics will be an added advantage.

  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Personal Assistant (Female)",
  "description": "At Xuriel Resources, we understand the challenges organisations face in the dynamic business environment; whether it is overcoming operational bottlenecks, managing talent effectively, or addressing organisational inefficiencies. Our approach goes beyond conventional solutions. We are innovators, strategists, and doers, providing the clarity and strategic vision needed to streamline operations, optimise human capital, and drive sustainable growth. Partnering with organisations of all sizes across diverse sectors; including Technology, Agriculture, Real Estate, Creative Industries, FMCG, and Education. We combine deep industry knowledge with a proven track record in human resources management, strategic planning, and operational optimisation. Our solutions are designed to benefit our clients, partners, and candidates alike, enabling them to thrive in a competitive landscape. We are more than just a service provider; we are your strategic partner for streamlined operations, talent development, and lasting impact.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Personal Assistant (Female)

Job Location:&nbsp;Ibadan, Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time
